Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg4401_04.jpg'}
{3: 'April 5th—One year after the disappearance of the Gray Raven Commandant, and eight months before Gestalt data wall would be torn down.'}
{3: 'Lamia returns to Luna with a bag of nuts after escaping from the underwater incident.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lamia', 3: '...Miss Luna, I am sorry for being late. I took a detour to get some gifts.', 4: '18'}
{3: "Luna looks at the bag of nuts in Lamia's hands and lets out a soft sigh."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Is this all you got back?'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'It... is quite a long story.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Get to the point.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "There's... there's more to it, but it's complicated.", 4: '18'}
{3: "She examines the timid mermaid before her. Lamia's nature seems to have subtly shifted in the past few months. She now cares about gifts and has a larger vocabulary."}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "Miss Luna, you already know what happened by the sea... don't you?", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Roland got back before you did. He told me everything.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "I... I ruined Vonnegut's plans. Do you think he might... take revenge while you're still recovering...?", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "Don't worry so much. You know how meticulous he is, so he would have stopped you right from the start if you really ruined his plan."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'His absence alone proves he is still hiding something.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "I might not be particularly close to him, but we're both Ascendants, so there's no need for a fight."}
{3: 'The girl imprisoned within the crystal takes another look at Lamia and the nuts in her hand.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Is this all you have to say?'}
{3: 'The mermaid finally gathers her courage to tell Luna about what happened under the sea. She talks without looking at Luna for half an hour while peeling nuts.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg4401_04.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lamia', 3: "Anyway... that's how it is...", 4: '18'}
{3: 'Lamia carefully offers Luna some nuts.'}
{3: "Under Lamia's evasive gaze, Luna lets out a sigh but accepts the gift."}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'I wanted to bring back the egg, but "Cthylla"" linked ""her" to herself instead.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: '...The egg stopped responding after that battle. It became just like any other Hetero-Creature.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'And then Cinderelik in the egg said... she wanted to save her memories of the Cthylla Project for Babylonia, so I...', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Cthylla was trying to stop you from taking the living egg even at the very end.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "Don't blame yourself. The intelligence you found is far more valuable than that dead egg."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Also, Vonnegut created it. He would never have let you deliver it to Babylonia if the egg was still alive and had any value.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "...Y-you're right. Lilith was very close to me... If she wanted to stop me, she would have already...", 4: '18'}
{3: 'They fall silent for a moment.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'What should we do about the re-filtering process?', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Lamia, how much do you know about Hetero-Creatures?'}
{3: 'Before obtaining the egg, she thought Hetero-Creatures and the Corrupted were similar, but now she knows better.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'A Hetero-Creature... is what remains when an individual is recycled and reconstructed by the Punishing.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: '...To control the Punishing is to influence Hetero-Creatures to some extent, and to determine what forms they take.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'To pass the filtering, first you must maintain your sense of self.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "Usually humans are ripped apart when their consciousnesses enter the Punishing. Only a few survive, and that's why we remain so low in numbers."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'This "survival" requires not only mind stability but also favorable opportunities and conditions.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'In contrast, the Ascension-Network determines who controls the Punishing by simply seeking out entities with greater information "weight."'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'This is why we used to believe that becoming an Ascendant required intense emotions—be it love, hatred, or an endless void.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "That egg perfectly met the Ascension-Network's criteria—it was a Hetero-Creature formed from concentrated Punishing, and had a consciousness stable enough..."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Agents could accomplish so much more with such a tool.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "Maybe Vonnegut isn't as omnipotent as they believe. He's just using tools."}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'That agent has done a lot of research on M.I.N.D. fusion. Is it to increase the "threshold" through patchwork?', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: '...The patchwork of consciousnesses...'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "That's right. Cthylla, who created all the children, has two distinct conciousnesses. Most of the time, both of the conciousnesses included Lithos himself.", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "Lithos' consciousness was deeply intertwined with Cthylla's. It helped her control both her humanoid form and the Tree of Life.", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'I think Lithos stopped her from escaping until he was forcefully expelled in the end...', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "Lithos' consciousness influenced her, but what about the other one?"}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'That consciousness only helped her control the "Leviathan" beneath the waves, a cradle for the rebirth of the dead.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'Consciousnesses within the Giant Whale had always maintained a minimal connection with Cthylla—they were practically unrelated.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "They might be free from Lithos and couldn't sense the others anymore, but the chains at the bottom of the sea were still...", 4: '18'}
{3: 'Lamia suddenly lifts her head to look at Luna at the mention of chains.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "Miss Luna... you're stuck here because you can no longer control the Punishing properly, right?", 4: '18'}
{3: 'Luna stays silent.'}
{3: 'Lamia takes several steps backward to keep a safe distance. She stops only after making sure that the bound Luna cannot reach her.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "There's not much I can do, and I hope Miss Luna won't think I'm rude...", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "If you tell me what's happening with you, I will do my best to help...", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'Because I... I have always wanted you to stay...', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "Ah, sorry! I didn't mean to say anything bad about you, Miss Luna. I just want to stay here with you.", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "That's why I hope you'll pass the Filtering safely. Then I can... I can stay in this familiar place.", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'Would that be alright...', 4: '18'}
{3: 'Luna gazes intently at Lamia. She has always thought that this mermaid acts mostly in her self-interest.'}
{3: "Her core nature hasn't changed, but she has grown more selfish—she now includes Luna in that self-interest."}
{3: "...Perhaps this isn't so bad."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'I am really losing control over the Punishing.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "But my situation is the exact opposite of Cthylla's."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'She was "patched together" with other consciousnesses, which gave her enough power to control the Tree of Life and spawn countless Hetero-Creatures.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "My consciousness is being dismantled and stripped away. I can feel the Ascension-Network's connection shifting toward... someone like myself."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Also, the Ascension-Network has evolved because of that Hetero Tower. The information stored within the Punishing has been searching for autonomy for a long time.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'Similar consciousnesses can have similar requests for the Ascension-Network... That\'s what happened with my sister and "that" sister back then.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: "I've been hearing less and less of those noises lately, and my authority as an agent has been fading with them."}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'I despise it, but it looks like I have no choice but to swallow this bitter pill.'}
{3: 'She falls into deep thought for a moment.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: '...Go where you wish to be, Lamia.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'When freedom arrives, I will call for you.'}
{2: 'Luna', 3: 'For now... I will use my remaining power to search for whatever is left on the Ascension-Network.'}
{3: "Luna's gaze goes past Lamia and lands in the distance. At the very far edge, a pale phantom stands where the Punishing concentration is highest."}
{3: 'The phantom slowly turns, extending both hands to her to reveal a crimson nightmare—a correct path to pass the re-filtering process.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: 'There is but one path to the future—find your lost hatred.', 6: '1'}
{3: 'There is but one path to the future—find your lost hatred.'}
